# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the solution using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as an argument, then it creates a new column `ym` that is the concatenation of year and month from each DateTime in the `dt` column. The year and month are extracted using the Dates.year() and Dates.month() functions respectively.

Please make sure to have Julia 1.6+ version installed on your machine, as well as the DataFrames package.
